root.TEXT:
Record date: 2069-04-15
EDVISIT^49921666^Schwartz, Xavier^04/15/69^NOLAN, N. YANCY(49863884)
TIME OF DICTATION: 10:40 p.m.
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: Mr. Schwartz is an 82-year-old male
who presents to Gwinnett County Hospital Department of
Emergency Medicine. He was sent to ED by his primary care
physician because of cough, productive of whitish sputum,
wheezing, and mild shortness of breath. He denies fever. He
denies chills. He denies any other acute complaints. He admits
to the above-mentioned symptoms. At times they last for two to
three days' duration. He has a temperature of 95, a pulse of 80,
respiratory rate of 20, blood pressure 153/80, and O2 saturation
95% on room air.
The resident's note was reviewed. The patient was interviewed.
The patient was examined by me. I concur with the workup and
evaluation of the patient in ED. For a more detailed note on
this patient, please review the resident's note. Please review
the resident's note for past medical history, surgical history,
review of systems, medications, allergies, family history and
social history.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: HEENT: Normocephalic, atraumatic. Pupils
were equal, round, reactive. Fundi were benign. Neck was
supple. Chest was positive for coarse rhonchi and wheezes
bilaterally. Heart: Notes a normal S1, S2. No S3, S4. No
murmur. Abdomen is benign, soft, nontender, no masses, guarding,
rebound, and organomegaly. Extremities: Grossly within normal
limits. Neurologically, awake, alert, able to follow all
commands. Negative Babinski.
Chest x-ray in the emergency department was negative for
infiltrates. Also negative for interstitial edema. The EKG
notes a paced rhythm at a rate of 91. White count of 8,
hematocrit was 36, normal serum electrolytes. Normal CK, normal
troponin.
******** Not reviewed by Attending Physician ********
breath most likely secondary to acute bronchitis.
PLAN: Admit to the Inpatient Service for further workup and
evaluation.
______________________________
NOLAN, N. YANCY M.D. (49863884) D: 04/15/69
T: 04/16/69
Dictated By: NOLAN, N. YANCY
